definition[0]: the end of the normal period of playing time in a sports game
example[0]: As the ball went in, the referee blew his whistle for full time.
definition[1]: for all the hours of a week during which it is usual for people to work, study etc
example[1]: She works full-time and has two kids.
example[2]: The success of the series enabled her to concentrate full-time on writing.
example[3]: They’re looking for full-time staff at the library.
example[4]: We aim to double the number of young people in full-time study.
definition[2]: working or studying for the complete number of hours that this is usually done
example[5]: He was unable physically to handle the demands of a full-time sales position.
example[6]: Mr Kasal slashed his full-time staff to six from 13 as revenue dropped.
example[7]: 5.5 million Americans are working part-time because they can’t find full-time work.
example[8]: Ohio has been gaining in part-time jobs, while losing many thousands of full-time jobs.
definition[3]: hard work that you are not paid for that takes a lot of time
example[9]: Searching for work is a full-time job.
